title: Understanding the Relationship Between Zein Solution Concentration and Nanoparticle Physicochemical Characteristics for Biomedical Use
content: This study delves into the influence of zein solution concentration on the synthesis and physicochemical characterization of nanoparticles tailored for biomedical applications. Utilizing a modified antisolvent procedure [1], nanoparticles were synthesized and subjected to meticulous analysis to elucidate their dimensions (Dynamic Light Scattering), surface charge (Î¶-potential), morphology (Scanning Electron Microscopy), and chemical composition (Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy). The obtained results unveiled a nanoparticle size distribution spanning from 120 to 170 nm (Fig. 1), which exhibited a direct correlation with fluctuations in zein concentration. Remarkably, akin to prior research findings [2], [3], the nanoparticles' size and morphology remained notably consistent across varying concentrations.
